decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's plans and control the game through a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. The deck aims to use cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, Phyrexian Revoker, and Karakas to slow down the opponent's plays and limit their options. At the same time, the deck utilizes efficient beaters like Mirran Crusader and Stoneforge Mystic to apply pressure and close out the game. The inclusion of powerful equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte helps to increase the deck's threat level and provide additional utility.

The deck aims to aggressively control the opponent's resources through a combination of early threats like Delver of Secrets, Nimble Mongoose, and Tarmogoyf, alongside disruptive spells like Daze, Force of Will, and Stifle. By maintaining a low curve and efficient removal in the form of Lightning Bolt and Forked Bolt, the deck can pressure the opponent while protecting its own creatures. The mana base, with fetch lands and dual lands, ensures consistent access to all necessary colors. Overall, the deck focuses on tempo and efficiency to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's resources while maintaining a strong board presence through aggressive creatures and equipment. By using cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker to slow down the opponent's plays and Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play, the deck aims to control the game tempo. Stoneforge Mystic and equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte provide additional value and combat versatility. With a mix of removal, disruption, and proactive threats, the deck seeks to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this Legacy Aggro deck is to aggressively control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy while quickly deploying threats like Delver of Secrets, Nimble Mongoose, and Tarmogoyf to apply pressure and close out the game. With a focus on tempo plays and efficient removal, the deck aims to stay ahead in tempo and maintain control of the game through countermagic and disruptive spells. The mana base is optimized for consistency and the ability to Wasteland the opponent's key lands, further enhancing the deck's ability to disrupt the opponent and secure victory.

The Merfolk deck focuses on flooding the board with efficient and disruptive creatures such as Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident, while using disruptive spells like Daze, Force of Will, and Spell Pierce to control the game. The deck also utilizes Aether Vial to cheat creatures onto the battlefield and maintain pressure on the opponent. Additionally, the inclusion of Wasteland and Standstill allows for disruption and card advantage, respectively, giving the deck multiple avenues to maintain tempo and pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Mother of Runes to put pressure on the opponent while controlling the board with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Umezawa's Jitte. It also has a land destruction plan with cards like Wasteland and Punishing Fire, while using Green Sun's Zenith to tutor for key creatures. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while applying pressure and eventually overwhelming them with its efficient creatures and powerful spells.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly cheat out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand onto the battlefield using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. The deck also includes plenty of counterspells like Force of Will, Spell Pierce, and Flusterstorm to protect your combo pieces and disrupt your opponent's game plan. With access to powerful mana acceleration with cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its ability to put massive threats on the board early in the game.

The deck focuses on aggressively pressuring the opponent with efficient threats like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf, while disrupting their game plan with cards like Force of Will, Hymn to Tourach, and Abrupt Decay. The mana base is streamlined to support both the aggro and midrange aspects of the deck, with Wasteland to disrupt opposing lands and Deathrite Shaman to provide additional utility. The goal is to quickly establish a board presence and control the game through disruption and efficient card selection with Brainstorm and Ponder.

The main idea of this Legacy 1 vs 1 deck is to quickly and efficiently cheat powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand into play using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with these big threats early in the game while using countermagic like Force of Will and Daze to protect its combo pieces. The deck also features card selection and manipulation tools like Brainstorm, Ponder, Intuition, and Sensei's Divining Top to ensure the combo pieces come together smoothly.

The main concept of this deck is to use a combination of efficient creatures, versatile removal spells, disruptive hand disruption, and powerful card advantage engines to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By utilizing cards like Shardless Agent to cascade into powerful spells like Ancestral Vision and Abrupt Decay, along with the ability to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach, this deck aims to grind out the opponent and eventually overpower them with cards like Tarmogoyf and Jace, the Mind Sculptor.

The deck focuses on being aggressive and utilizing a low mana curve to control the game by constantly applying pressure on the opponent. By using efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Nimble Mongoose, and Tarmogoyf, along with disruptive spells such as Daze, Force of Will, and Stifle, the deck aims to keep the opponent on the back foot while maintaining card advantage through cards like Brainstorm and Ponder. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Dismember to deal with opposing threats, allowing the deck to maintain tempo and close out games quickly.

This deck focuses on generating value through card advantage and efficient removal spells, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Tarmogoyf, Dark Confidant, and Liliana of the Veil, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while steadily building up its own board presence. The inclusion of Punishing Fire as a recurring removal option adds to the deck's resilience in dealing with threats. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and disrupt the opponent's strategy through a combination of efficient creatures and removal spells.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Counterspell, while also utilizing removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Terminus to deal with threats. Card advantage is gained through cards like Brainstorm, Snapcaster Mage, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The win condition of the deck is either through casting Entreat the Angels for a large number of Angel tokens or using Planeswalkers like Elspeth, Knight-Errant and Jace, the Mind Sculptor for incremental advantage.

The main concept of this Legacy 1 vs 1 deck is to be an aggressive deck with a mix of control elements. The deck focuses on playing efficient creatures like Geist of Saint Traft, Snapcaster Mage, and Vendilion Clique, while also having access to counter spells like Spell Pierce and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also utilizes card advantage and control through cards like Brainstorm and Standstill, while having removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Swords to Plowshares to handle threats. Overall, the deck aims to be fast and disruptive, pressuring the opponent while controlling the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through powerful creatures and disruption spells, utilizing cards like Dark Confidant, Deathrite Shaman, and Stoneforge Mystic to generate advantage. It also includes a variety of removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Thoughtseize to stall the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to protect its threats using counterspells and planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil while also applying pressure with equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte. The mana base includes fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to all colors of mana.

The deck focuses on using a combination of disruption, card advantage, and efficient creatures to outvalue and control opponents in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches. It utilizes efficient removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Baleful Strix to handle threats, while also leveraging powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil for card advantage and disruption. By combining these elements with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Deathrite Shaman, the deck aims to control the game and dictate the pace of play to ultimately emerge victorious.

The main idea of this Legacy Elves deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly and efficiently through the use of cards like Gaea's Cradle and Heritage Druid, while also benefiting from creatures' enter-the-battlefield effects and card draw from cards like Elvish Visionary and Wirewood Symbiote. The deck aims to assemble a critical mass of Elves on the battlefield, ramping into powerful finishers like Craterhoof Behemoth or Regal Force through cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Natural Order. Additionally, disruption and hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize help protect the combo from opponent interference.

The main concept of this Show and Tell combo deck is to quickly cheat out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn using cards like Show and Tell, Enter the Infinite, and Omniscience. The deck relies on utilizing cards such as Brainstorm, Cunning Wish, and Ponder to set up its combo pieces and protect them with Force of Will and Pact of Negation if necessary. By using Dream Halls and Leyline of Sanctity to accelerate and protect its game plan, this deck aims to overwhelm its opponent and win the game in just a few turns.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly generate a large amount of mana using cards like Dark Ritual, Lion's Eye Diamond, and Lotus Petal, in order to cast a storm spell like Tendrils of Agony and win the game in a single turn. The deck includes a variety of card draw, hand disruption, and tutor effects to help find the necessary combo pieces and protect the player's strategy. Burning Wish allows for additional flexibility and access to sideboard cards, while Ad Nauseam can provide a massive card advantage. The deck aims to be fast and efficient in executing its win condition.

The deck focuses on locking down opponents' mana bases with cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Painter's Servant, while assembling a lethal combo with Grindstone. It also includes disruption in the form of Pyroblast and Red Elemental Blast, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt. Imperial Recruiter helps tutor for key combo pieces, while acceleration is provided by mana rocks like Chrome Mox and creatures like Simian Spirit Guide. Jaya Ballard, Task Mage and Phyrexian Metamorph offer additional utility and versatility to the deck.

This deck focuses on creating explosive combos by utilizing cards that allows the player to manipulate the top of their library, draw cards, and protect their game plan with counterspells. The key strategy involves setting up Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top to control the opponent's spells, while also generating card advantage with Accumulated Knowledge and Ponder. With the help of Snapcaster Mage and Trinket Mage, the deck can efficiently search for key pieces like Engineered Explosives or Helm of Awakening to achieve a powerful win condition with Grapeshot.

The deck focuses on utilizing cheap and efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Nimble Mongoose, and Tarmogoyf, along with powerful burn spells like Chain Lightning and Lightning Bolt to quickly apply pressure to the opponent. The deck also includes counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect its threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a strong mana base and cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistent draws, the deck aims to maintain tempo and aggression throughout the game.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Goblin Guide, while also utilizing powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck's mana base is flexible with fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to both red and blue mana. It also includes counterspells like Daze and Flusterstorm to protect its creatures and spells, making it a fast-paced and efficient aggro deck focused on dealing damage quickly and efficiently.
